intro: Hieracium aequilingua, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Hieracium aequilingua is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
